page.title: 07WILDLIFE IN SOUTH DEVON
page.content: As our area is almost unpopulated by people,animal life here is very varied.Perhaps the most common species of wildlife is the rabbit.There are also rarer species such as foxes and badgers,for example.Most wild animals are not seen during the daytime (though unfortunately if you do they are usually dead,run down by cars), but if you are driving through the lanes at night it is surprising how many animals there are.Stoats and weasels live in the banks and hedgerows.Perhaps the farm cats should be included when talking about wild animals,because many of these are wild and cannot be domesticated. Although there is little organised hunting most of the farmers keep shotguns to keep down the level of pests,mostly rabbits and some birds which damage crops.Dairy farmers are
